title: Blocking
question_text: Adults in a local city have volunteered to participate in an experiment. The statistician organizing the experiment decides to use a randomized block design. The purpose of the experiment is to compare two hair shampoos that claim to moisturize even the driest of scalps. Which of the following methods should the statistician use when forming the blocks?

choices.text: Volunteers in the same block should receive the same shampoo.
Volunteers should be randomly assigned to the blocks.
Volunteers within each block should be as similar as possible with respect to how dry their scalp is prior to using the shampoo.
Volunteers within each block should be as different as possible with respect to how dry their scalp is prior to using the shampoo.
Volunteers should be kept blind as to which block they are in.
